block.p: Polly Ann Roberts, a daughter of Susan and Gene Roberts of Washington, is to be married today to Andrew Paul Golden, the son of Dr. Howard Golden of Miami and the late Sheila Lubin Golden. Rabbi Mitchell Chefitz is to officiate at the Miami Beach Rod and Reel Club on Hibiscus Island.
In May, the bride and the bridegroom received Master of Fine Arts degrees in creative writing from Florida International University.

Polly Ann Roberts, a daughter of Susan and Gene Roberts of Washington, is to be married today to Andrew Paul Golden, the son of Dr. Howard Golden of Miami and the late Sheila Lubin Golden. Rabbi Mitchell Chefitz is to officiate at the Miami Beach Rod and Reel Club on Hibiscus Island.
In May, the bride and the bridegroom received Master of Fine Arts degrees in creative writing from Florida International University.

Ms. Roberts, 28, is keeping her name. She teaches high school English, history and humanities at Holy Cross Academy in Miami. She graduated from the University of Chicago. Her father, a former executive editor of The Philadelphia Inquirer and former managing editor of The New York Times, is a professor of journalism at the University of Maryland in College Park.

Mr. Golden, 33, is a bartender at Monty's Raw Bar in Coconut Grove, Fla., and a writer. He graduated from Emory University. His father is a senior psychiatrist at the South Florida Evaluation and Treatment Center in Miami.
